verses.roman:
rātrye uṭhi' vana-pathe palāñā yāba
ekākī yāiba, kāhoṅ saṅge nā la-iba

synonyms: rātrye uṭhi'-rising at night; vana-pathe—on the road to the forest; palāñā yāba—I shall go away secretly; ekākī yāiba—I shall go alone; kāhoṅ—anyone; saṅge—with Me; nā la-iba—I shall not take.
translation: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu said, "I shall leave early in the morning and go incognito, taking the road to the forest. I shall go alone and not take anyone with Me.
